entry.title: $2600 // Lease takeover on rent stabilized 2br/1ba in Castlebraid
entry.content:
I've lived in NYC for 10 years but am gradually taking on more and more international clients and don't want to deal with the hassle of maintaining my beloved apartment anymore. I just came back to visit and learned my favorite bar is closing. So I think it's time to dig up my roots and leave NYC.

You can take over my active lease in the rent stabilized apartment I have rented for the past 8 years. If I simply don't resign the lease, rent would be $1000/mo more than what I pay, as the neighborhood is blowing up. If you take it over, you have to submit an application to the building owners and if they approve you, I would ask a fee for the transfer costs and you would become the master leaseholder.

The building is Castlebraid, very famous artist residence in Bushwick in the middle of everything and 5 mins from trains to Manhattan.

I am available to show the space August 5, Aug 6, and Aug 7.

Email me to set up a time.
